resources.string: A care pathway is used as logical groupings for clinical protocols defined in the CDSS Library. A care pathway allows patients to be "enrolled" (either automatically or manually). Once enrolled, a Care Plan is created based on the CDSS rules configured. This allows SanteEMR plugins and programmes to track care against a known best practice and compare with actual care delivery.
Are you sure you want to delete this care pathway? This will not remove the CDSS logic, it will merely remove the enrollment settings.
Care pathway has been successfully deleted

This screen allows you to edit the EMR visit types and the associated flow of those visit types. A visit type is a sub-classification of a visit used in SanteEMR and generally classifies the nature of a visit (example: Ambulatory, Outpatient, Pediatric, etc.). This is further specified by layering a template atop these classifications (example: type may be pediatric however there may be templates for vaccination, growth, IMCI, etc.).
Are you sure you want to remove this type of visit from your EMR installation?
EMR visit type has been removed from iCDR
Select the classification concept that the flow and visit type is bound to. You can use the Concept Dictionary screen to create new concepts
Configure the flow of a person undertaking this visit will undergo
Are you sure you want to remove this flow state?

In SanteEMR a clinical data template represents a binding between a data element in the Reference Information Model and the user interface. These templates are used to further specify and render clinical data into the user interface. Where as a classification or type concept will be used in the database to identify a piece of information, the template lets SanteEMR and SanteIMS to further distinguish how a piece of data will be rendered, and collected

This dialog will allow you to submit a new clinical template definition file which was exported from another SanteDB server or provided by your system application developer. Note: Readonly template definitions cannot be uploaded or modified
Select the template definition file and press upload.
Definition file has been uploaded successfully
Are you sure you want to remove the template definition?
The clinical template definition has been removed
This clinical template is readonly and cannot be modified
This data points to a resource contained in an applet. Unfortunately, this means that this template content cannot be edited in the user interface, and instead should be edited in the applet
No Views are present in the template
Data template has been saved successfully
Are you sure you want to activate/deactivate this template?
This view is defined using a simplified format. For more features switch to HTML
Are you sure you want to switch this view to HTML? This operation cannot be undone
Are you sure you want to remove this view from the template?
Are you sure you want to restore this template?
Clinical data template has been successfully restored
